newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Oct 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Oct 9.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Opposition leader Begum Khaleda Zia said her Bangladesh Nationlist Party (BNP) would play "responsible role" in parliament to help institutionalise democracy in the country.
The government may place two separate bills in the next session of parliament, seeking separation of the judiuciary from the executive organ of the state, officials said.

Bangladesh Foreign Minister Abdus Samad Azad, addressing the 51st session of UN Genral Assembly on Tuesday, has stressed on an international code of water ethics to help countries in their efforts towards bilateral and multilateral agreements on sharing of water.
The government will start selling shares of a multinational company, Reckitt and Colman Bangladesh Ltd, later this month, as part of its plan to offload the shares it holds in different companies.
The government will soon stop selling of foreign cigarettes without mention of statutory warning about health printed on the packet in a bid to what official sources said check smuggling.
Bangladesh Tuesday urged the European Union to raise the quantum of its assistance in view of the country's expanding development needs and priorities.
